title: CI/CD Pipeline Setup
description:
Configure Production-Ready CI/CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions

Implement a comprehensive continuous integration and deployment system using GitHub Actions that automates code quality checks, testing, building, and deployment across multiple environments.

Requirements:

**Workflow Structure:**
- Create separate workflow files for CI (.github/workflows/ci.yml) and CD (.github/workflows/deploy.yml)
- Configure CI to trigger on pull requests and pushes to main/develop branches
- Configure CD to trigger on merge to main (staging) and on version tags (production)

**Continuous Integration Pipeline:**
- Run linting and code formatting checks (ESLint, Prettier, or language-specific tools)
- Execute full test suite (unit, integration, end-to-end tests)
- Perform security vulnerability scanning
- Generate code coverage reports and enforce minimum thresholds
- Run parallel jobs for different test suites to optimize execution time
- Implement caching for dependencies (npm, pip, maven, etc.) and build artifacts

**Build Process:**
- Compile/bundle application for target environments
- Optimize build output (minification, tree-shaking, compression)
- Generate build artifacts and upload for deployment jobs
- Validate build artifacts before deployment

**Deployment Configuration:**
- Set up staging deployment on merge to main branch
- Set up production deployment on tagged releases (e.g., v*.*.*)
- Implement deployment approval gates for production
- Configure environment-specific variables and secrets using GitHub Environments
- Include rollback strategy or deployment verification steps
- Add smoke tests post-deployment to verify successful deployment

**Security & Access Control:**
- Store sensitive credentials (API keys, deployment tokens) in GitHub Secrets
- Use GitHub Environments for environment-specific secrets and protection rules
- Configure OIDC for cloud provider authentication (avoid long-lived credentials)
- Implement least-privilege access for deployment workflows

**Monitoring & Notifications:**
- Add workflow status badges to README.md
- Configure Slack/Discord/email notifications for build failures
- Set up notifications for successful production deployments
- Include workflow run summaries with test results and coverage

**Branch Protection:**
- Enable branch protection on main branch requiring status checks to pass
- Require at least one approval for pull requests
- Prevent force pushes and deletions
- Enable "Require branches to be up to date before merging"

**Documentation:**
- Create CONTRIBUTING.md documenting the CI/CD workflow
- Document how to add/modify workflow steps
- Explain secret management and how to rotate credentials
- Provide troubleshooting guide for common workflow failures
- Document deployment process and rollback procedures

**Performance Optimization:**
- Implement dependency caching to reduce installation time
- Use matrix strategy for testing across multiple versions/platforms if needed
- Configure concurrent job execution where possible
- Set appropriate timeout limits for jobs

Success Criteria:
- CI pipeline completes in under 10 minutes for typical changes
- Zero manual steps required from code merge to staging deployment
- Production deployments require manual approval and complete successfully
- Failed tests automatically block PR merging
- Build status is visible at a glance via README badges
- Team receives immediate notification of pipeline failures
- All secrets are stored securely and never exposed in logs
